Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.custom_data_structures

Class IntegerStack

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.custom_data_structures.IntegerStack
public class IntegerStack extends Object
This class contains an integer that can be incremented by any amount and likewise be reduced, on the condition its value never falls below zero

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    IntegerStack()
    same as the default constructor but the given amount is 0 by default

  • Constructor Details

    • IntegerStack

      public IntegerStack(int amount) throws NegativeInputException
      Parameters:
      amount - is the initial amount we want the IntegerStack to have
      Throws:
      NegativeInputException - is thrown when the starting amount would be negative, thus creating a negative amount integer

    • IntegerStack

      public IntegerStack() throws NegativeInputException
      same as the default constructor but the given amount is 0 by default
      Throws:
      NegativeInputException - is present so that the signature for both te constructors is identical

  • Method Details

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      used to check whether the IntegerStack is empty or not
      Returns:
      the truth value of IntegerStack's amount being 0

    • size

      public int size()
      used to get the size of the IntegerStack
      Returns:
      the value of amount in IntegerStack

    • add

      public void add(int amountToAdd) throws NegativeInputException
      increases the "amount" value of the called object by the desired amount, as long as such a value is non-negative
      Parameters:
      amountToAdd - the quantity the caller wants to Increase the IntegerStack amount attribute by
      Throws:
      NegativeInputException - thrown when the input value is below zero

    • decreaseBy

      public void decreaseBy(int toReduce) throws NegativeAmountException, NegativeInputException
      the exact opposite of the "add" method
      Parameters:
      toReduce - the amount IntegerStack's amount has to be reduced by
      Throws:
      NegativeAmountException - thrown when the toReduce value would make the IntegerStack amount attribute fall below zero
      NegativeInputException - thrown when the input value is below zero

    • inject

      public void inject(IntegerStack toInject)

      the amount value of the called object is increased by the argument's amount value

      the argument is left unchanged

      Parameters:
      toInject - IntegerStack whose content are to be injected, this object is unaffected by the method call
